briefdescription.para: Device is idle.
Multimeter is measuring DC voltage.
Multimeter is measuring AC voltage.
Multimeter is measuring DC current.
Multimeter is measuring AC current.
Multimeter is measuring resistance.
Multimeter is measuring diode.
Multimeter is measuring continuity.
Multimeter is measuring temperature.
DSO is sampling.
Data Logger is sampling.
Values supported by the Status attribute of the Status characteristic.
Low (replace battery).
Good.
Values supported by the Battery Status attribute of the Status characteristic.
Device is switched to Voltage position.
Device is switched to Resistance / Low Current / Capacitance / Diode position.
Device is switched to High Current position.
Values supported by the (undocumented) Switch Position attribute of the Status characteristic.

xrefdescription.para: These enum values are undocumented, but easily testable with a physical Pokit Pro device. Internally, Pokit's Android app calls these: SWITCH_MODE_VOLTAGE, SWITCH_MODE_ALL and SWITCH_MODE_CURRENT.

briefdescription.para: Battery is dischargin.
Battery is being charged.
Battery is fully charged.
Values supported by the (undocumented) Charging Statue attribute of the Status characteristic.
Torch is off.
Torch is on.
Values supported by the single byte of the attribute of the (undocumented) Torch characteristic.
Button was released.
Button was pressed.
Button was held down (for typically 1,500ms).
Values supported by the second byte of the attribute of the (undocumented) Button Press characteristic.
Returns a string version of the status enum label.
Returns a string version of the status enum label.
Returns a string version of the position enum label.
Returns a string version of the status enum label.
Returns a string version of the status enum label.
Returns a string version of the status enum label.
Constructs a new Pokit service with parent.
Destroys this StatusService object.
Read all characteristics.

detaileddescription.para: This convenience function will queue refresh requests of all characteristics supported by this service.
Relevant *Service::*Read signals will be emitted by derived class objects as each characteristic is successfully read.

briefdescription.para: Read the Status service's Device Characteristics characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the read request is succesfully queued, false otherwise (ie if the underlying controller it not yet connected to the Pokit device, or the device's services have not yet been discovered).
Emits deviceCharacteristicsRead() if/when the characteristic has been read successfully.

briefdescription.para: Read the Status service's Status characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the read request is succesfully queued, false otherwise (ie if the underlying controller it not yet connected to the Pokit device, or the device's services have not yet been discovered).
Emits deviceStatusRead() if/when the characteristic has been read successfully.

briefdescription.para: Read the Status service's Name characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the read request is succesfully queued, false otherwise (ie if the underlying controller it not yet connected to the Pokit device, or the device's services have not yet been discovered).
Emits deviceNameRead() if/when the characteristic has been read successfully.

briefdescription.para: Read the Status service's (undocumented) Torch characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the read request is succesfully queued, false otherwise (ie if the underlying controller it not yet connected to the Pokit device, or the device's services have not yet been discovered).
Emits torchStatusRead() if/when the characteristic has been read successfully.

briefdescription.para: Read the Status service's (undocumented) Button Press characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the read request is succesfully queued, false otherwise (ie if the underlying controller it not yet connected to the Pokit device, or the device's services have not yet been discovered).
Emits buttonPressRead() if/when the characteristic has been read successfully.

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent value of the Status service's Device Characteristics characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value, if any, is from the underlying Bluetooth stack's cache. If no such value is currently available (ie the serviceDetailsDiscovered signal has not been emitted yet), then a null result is returned, which can be checked via the returned DeviceCharacteristics::firmwareVersion, like:

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent value of the Status service's Status characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value, if any, is from the underlying Bluetooth stack's cache. If no such value is currently available (ie the serviceDetailsDiscovered signal has not been emitted yet), then the returned StatusService::Status::batteryLevel member will be a quiet NaN, which can be checked like:
Not all Pokit devices support the Status::batteryStatus member, in which case the member will be initilialised to the maximum value supported by the underlying type (ie 255) to indicate "not set"

briefdescription.para: Enables client-side notifications of device status changes.

detaileddescription.para: This is an alternative to manually requesting individual reads via readStatusCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.
Successfully read values (if any) will be emitted via the deviceStatusRead() signal.

briefdescription.para: Disables client-side notifications of device status changes.

detaileddescription.para: Instantaneous status can still be fetched by readStatusCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent value of the Status services's Device Name characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value, if any, is from the underlying Bluetooth stack's cache. If no such value is currently available (ie the serviceDetailsDiscovered signal has not been emitted yet), then a null QString is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set's the Pokit device's name to name.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the write request was successfully queued, false otherwise.
Emits deviceNameWritten() if/when the name has been set.

briefdescription.para: Flash the Pokit device's LED.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the flash request was successfully queued, false otherwise.
Emits deviceLedFlashed() if/when the LED has flashed successfully.

simplesect.para: This operation is only supported by Pokit Meter devices. Pokit Pro devices will report an Bluetooth ATT error 0x80.

xrefdescription.para: The Android app can turn Pokit Pro LEDs on/off. Perhaps that is handled by an undocumented use of this characteristic. Or perhaps its via some other service.

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent value of the Status services's Torch characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value, if any, is from the underlying Bluetooth stack's cache. If no such value is currently available (eg if the device does not support the Torch characteristic), then nullopt is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the Pokit device's torch to status.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the request was successfully queued, false otherwise.
Emits torchStatusWritten() if/when the LED has flashed successfully.

simplesect.para: This operation is only supported by Pokit Pro devices, and not Pokit Meter devices.

briefdescription.para: Enables client-side notifications of torch status changes.

detaileddescription.para: This is an alternative to manually requesting individual reads via readTorchCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.
Successfully read values (if any) will be emitted via the torchStatusRead() signal.

briefdescription.para: Disables client-side notifications of torch status changes.

detaileddescription.para: Instantaneous torch status can still be fetched by readTorchCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent value of the Status services's Button Press characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value, if any, is from the underlying Bluetooth stack's cache. If no such value is currently available (eg if the device does not support the Torch characteristic), then nullopt is returned.

briefdescription.para: Enables client-side notifications of button presses.

detaileddescription.para: This is an alternative to manually requesting individual reads via readButtonPressCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.
Successfully read values (if any) will be emitted via the torchStatusRead() signal.

briefdescription.para: Disables client-side notifications of button presses.

detaileddescription.para: Instantaneous button press statussed can still be fetched by readButtonPressCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This signal is emitted when the Device Characteristics characteristic has been read successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Device Name characteristic has been read successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Device Name characteristic has been written successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Status characteristic has been read successfully.
This signal is emitted when device's LED has flashed in response to a write of the Flash LED characteristic.
This signal is emitted when the Torch characteristic has been read successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Torch characteristic has been written successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Button Press characteristic has been read successfully.
Constructs a new Pokit service with parent, and private implementation d.
The StatusService class accesses the Pokit Status service of Pokit devices.
